name: Beyond the Pillars of Hercules
description:
In Inferno XXVI Dante Alighieri
mentions Ulysses in the pit of the
Fraudulent Counsellors and his
voyage past the Pillars of Hercules.
Ulysses justifies endangering his
sailors by the fact that his goal is to
gain knowledge of the unknown. After
five months of navigation in the
ocean, Ulysses sights the mountain of
Purgatory but encounters a whirlwind
from it that sinks his ship and all on it
for their daring to approach Purgatory
while alive, by their strength and wits
alone.
